item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市大幅下跌后将迎来上涨
item.description: 3 月，富时罗素将韩国列入其世界政府债券指数的观察名单。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：FTSE Russell kept South Korea on the watch list for inclusion in its World Government Bond Index in March. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 黄金周前澳门博彩收入超出预期
item.description: 澳门 9 月份的博彩收入同比增长 15.5%，超过分析师的预期，因为赌场正在为中国最大的节假日之一做准备，而节假日通常会刺激人们前往这个赌博中心。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue rose 15.5% year-on-year in September, exceeding analysts’ forecast as casinos gear up for one of China’s biggest holidays, which usually fuels travel to the gambling hub.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 卢旺达确认 27 例马尔堡病毒感染病例，9 人死亡
item.description: 卢旺达卫生部称，该国首次爆发马尔堡病毒疫情，目前已报告有 9 人死亡，并确认有 18 名病人被隔离。【原文：Rwanda has reported nine deaths from its first-ever Marburg virus outbreak and confirmed 18 patients are in isolation, according to its health ministry.】

item.title: 不惜一切代价开启中国黄金周
item.description:
刺激措施让市场飙升，投资者可以笑着享受假期了。【原文：

Investors can enjoy their holidays with a smile after stimulus measures send markets roaring.

】

item.title: 菲律宾航空公司在需求疲软和紧张局势下削减中国航班
item.description: 菲律宾航空公司（Philippine Airlines Inc.【原文：Philippine Airlines Inc. is cutting back flights to China, becoming the latest carrier to reduce traffic amid weak travel demand and fraying relations between Beijing and Manila.】

item.title: 美国东海岸和海湾港口自 1977 年以来首次罢工关闭
item.description: 就在总统大选前几周，美国东海岸和海湾地区的各大港口都发生了码头工人罢工事件，这标志着一场可能波及世界最大经济体并引发政治动荡的罢工的开始。【原文：Dockworkers have walked out of every major port on the US East and Gulf coasts, marking the beginning of a strike that could ripple through the world’s largest economy and cause political turmoil just weeks before the presidential election.】

item.title: 投资者热捧印度 摆脱阿达尼做空者攻击
item.description:
尽管兴登堡公司的报告指责该企业集团存在欺诈行为，但印度股市仍大幅飙升。【原文：

Indian shares are surging despite Hindenburg’s report accusing the conglomerate of fraud.

】

item.title: 美国购物者今年假日消费有望增长 7
item.description: 普华永道（PwC）称，预计美国购物者今年将增加假日消费，但这一增长掩盖了低收入消费者日益增长的压力。【原文：US shoppers are expected to boost their holiday spending this year — but the increase masks growing stress among lower-income consumers, according to PwC.】

item.title: 法国总统巴尼耶在议会走钢丝：看点
item.description: 本周二，米歇尔-巴尼耶将首次以总理身份面对法国议会，发表事关成败的演讲，概述他计划如何重新控制公共财政，同时应对立法者之间的激烈分歧。【原文：Michel Barnier will face France’s parliament for the first time as prime minister on Tuesday to deliver a make-or-break speech outlining how he plans to regain control of public finances while navigating bitter divisions between lawmakers.】

item.title: 瑞典业主以三年来最快速度出售债券
item.description: 随着利率下降推动债券发行量激增，瑞典房东正以自 2021 年繁荣期以来从未有过的数量重返债券市场。【原文：Swedish landlords are returning to the bond market in numbers not seen since the boom year of 2021 as falling interest rates drive a surge in issuance.】

item.title: 中国股市突变，创 1999 年以来新高
item.description: 几个月来，在股票投资者中，对中国股票给予广泛关注似乎是最明智的交易之一。现在情况突然发生了变化。【原文：For months, giving Chinese equities the wide berth looked to be one of the smartest trades among stock investors. The tide has suddenly turned.】

item.title: 中国股市反弹引发印度股市资金外流担忧
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 击败 96% 同行的印度顶级基金看好医院行业
item.description: 据印度表现最好的基金称，印度的医院股将受益于医疗保健支出的预期增长。【原文：India’s hospital stocks are set to benefit from the expected growth in healthcare spending, according to the country’s top-performing fund.】

item.title: 日元摇摆不定，中国重新崛起，预示着亚洲本季度的动荡不安
item.description: 过去三个月，亚洲资产受到一系列划时代事件的冲击，大量迹象表明，这种波动还远未结束。【原文：Asian assets were whipsawed over the past three months by a succession of epochal events and plenty of signs suggest the volatility is far from over.】

item.title: 德雷福斯收购棉花公司近一半股份，即将完成收购
item.description: 路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）在收购了澳大利亚Namoi棉花有限公司近一半的股份后，提高了对该公司的收购报价，出价超过了仍在等待监管部门批准的Olam Agri控股有限公司。【原文：Louis Dreyfus Co. raised its offer for Namoi Cotton Ltd. after acquiring nearly half of the Australian company’s shares, outbidding Olam Agri Holdings Ltd., which is still waiting for regulatory approval.】

item.title: 伯克希尔计划新一轮日元债券销售，促进贸易公司发展
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. is planning its second yen bond sale this year, fueling gains in trading houses on speculation it’s looking to boost investments in Japan.】

item.title: 海伦飓风导致 Sibelco 石英矿停产
item.description: 石英矿商 Sibelco 正在努力重启其位于北卡罗来纳州斯普鲁斯派恩的工厂，此前该工厂曾因飓风海伦而关闭。【原文：Quartz miner Sibelco is working to restart operations at its Spruce Pine facility in North Carolina after it was shut due to Hurricane Helene.】

item.title: 销售降温，新加坡房价年内首次下跌
item.description: 由于市场销售放缓，新加坡房价五个季度以来首次下跌。【原文：Singapore’s home prices fell for the first time in five quarters as a sales slowdown weighed on the market.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州 A&M 公司建议采用埃隆-马斯克的 Boring Co.
item.description: 德克萨斯 A&M 大学正在考虑与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Boring Co.公司合作，以减少其不断扩大的校园内的拥堵现象。【原文：Texas A&M University is considering working with Elon Musk’s Boring Co. to reduce congestion on its growing campus.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。中国股市牛气冲天，美国股市也难以望其项背。北京放宽购房规定。谷歌计划在泰国投资 10 亿美元。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. China’s equity bull run barely registers with US stocks. Beijing eases rules for homebuyers. Google plans to invest $1 billion in Thailand. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中东紧张局势与利比亚供应前景交织，石油价格趋于稳定
item.description: 第四季度伊始，由于中东地缘政治风险（以色列开始在黎巴嫩境内进行地面袭击）与利比亚恢复供应的前景并存，石油价格保持稳定。【原文：Oil was steady at the start of the fourth quarter as geopolitical risks in the Middle East, with Israel beginning ground raids inside Lebanon, vied with the prospects of a return of Libyan supply.】

item.title: 加拿大呼吁七国集团加大对以色列施压迫使其接受停火协议
item.description: 就在五天前，加拿大外长梅拉妮-乔利还坚信以色列和真主党之间的停火即将实现。然后，以色列军队杀死了真主党领导人哈桑-纳斯鲁拉，伊朗发誓要报复。【原文：Just five days ago, Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly was convinced a cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah was near. Then Israeli forces killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, and Iran vowed revenge.】

item.title: 美联储推动全球降息，尽管2025年问题重重
item.description: 随着全球通胀冲击的最后痕迹逐渐消失，随着各经济体迈向充满未知的新的一年，向降低借贷成本的转变将保持势头。【原文：With the last traces of the global inflation shock fading, the shift toward lower borrowing costs is about to maintain momentum as economies tread toward a new year fraught with unknowns.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦寻求通过新建管道促进对华天然气出口
item.description: 哈萨克斯坦正在与中国就增加天然气出口进行谈判，甚至考虑增建一条管道以增加天然气流量，这凸显了哈萨克斯坦在该地区燃料市场中日益重要的作用。【原文：Kazakhstan is in talks with China about increasing gas exports and is even considering building an additional pipeline to boost flows, underscoring the growing significance of its role in the region’s fuel market.】

item.title: 马来西亚证券交易所推出增值计划吸引股票交易者
item.description: 马来西亚证券交易所正在酝酿一项提高本地公司估值的计划，以吸引全球投资者。【原文：The Malaysian bourse is mulling a plan to improve valuations of local companies as it seeks to lure global investors amid similar programs from regional peers.】

item.title: 日本股市将在暴跌后收复失地：市场综述
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发表了新的言论，表示没有进一步降息的紧迫性，日本股市在周二早盘不温不火的美国股市之后有望获得提振。【原文：Japanese stocks were poised for a lift early Tuesday following a tepid US session as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made fresh comments signaling no urgency for further interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 借款人打破全球记录出售 6000 亿美元债务
item.description: 随着收益率的下降和美国总统大选的临近，全球各地的公司和政府纷纷在债务市场上购买债券和贷款，借入资金。【原文：Companies and governments across the globe are flooding debt markets with bonds and loans, borrowing money as yields fall and the US presidential election nears.】

item.title: 巴黎人报》称法国总理计划增税 200 亿美元
item.description: 据《巴黎人报》报道，法国总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）计划宣布征收额外税收，以筹集150亿至180亿欧元（约合167亿至200亿美元）的资金，同时研究如何重新控制该国的公共财政。【原文：French Prime Minister Michel Barnier plans to announce additional taxes to raise between €15 billion and €18 billion ($16.7-$20 billion) as he looks at ways to regain control of the country’s public finances, according to Le Parisien newspaper.】

item.title: 埃尔根需要曾被他唾弃的债权人来完成 Dish-DirecTV 交易
item.description: 查理-厄根（Charlie Ergen）几十年来一直梦想着将他的卫星电视公司 Dish Network Corp. 与竞争对手 DirecTV 合并，但这取决于他过去曾惹恼过的债权人是否愿意注销他们在这家负债累累的公司的部分投资。【原文：Charlie Ergen’s decades-long dream to combine his satellite-TV company Dish Network Corp. with rival DirecTV hinges on the willingness of creditors he has irked in the past to write off part of their investment in the heavily indebted company.】
